summary: The Fix Our Forests Act aims to expedite and improve forest management on federal and tribal lands. It focuses on reducing wildfire risk through various measures, including designation of fireshed management areas, expansion of collaborative tools (like good neighbor agreements), and litigation reform. The bill also addresses community wildfire protection, promotes transparency and technology in forest management (including biochar and CAFFS), supports white oak resilience, and ensures casualty assistance for firefighters. The bill covers many aspects of forest management and aims to improve forest health, reduce wildfire risk, and support communities.
